gw.solr.request

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractSearchRequest(java.io.File configFile, java.util.List<SolrSortColumn> sortColumns)
      Base class for generating Solr search requests. Use this constructor if Solr queries are being submitted as POST requests encoded as UTF-8 (recommended and standard.)
      AbstractSearchRequest(java.io.File configFile, java.util.List<SolrSortColumn> sortColumns, java.lang.String uriEncoding)
      Base class for generating Solr search requests. Guidewire recommends Solr queries be submitted via POST requests. However, in the event queries must be submitted via GET requests, the URI encoding in use by the container hosting Solr (e.g. Tomcat) should be specified for the uri encoding parameter here. The servlet specification declares the default URI encoding is ISO-8859-1. However, some containers default to a different value (e.g. embedded Solr uses UTF-8). If queries sent via GET don't appear to work properly for extended ASCII or unicode characters, be sure this value is set properly for the container you are using.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSearchRequest

        AbstractSearchRequest(java.io.File configFile,
                     java.util.List<SolrSortColumn> sortColumns)
        Base class for generating Solr search requests. Use this constructor if Solr queries are being submitted as POST requests encoded as UTF-8 (recommended and standard.)
        Parameters:
        configFile - Reference to the {doc}-search-config.xml file.
        sortColumns - Only useful for paging queries. Likely to be deprecated as sorting other than by score in Solr is not particular useful.

      • AbstractSearchRequest

        AbstractSearchRequest(java.io.File configFile,
                     java.util.List<SolrSortColumn> sortColumns,
                     java.lang.String uriEncoding)
        Base class for generating Solr search requests. Guidewire recommends Solr queries be submitted via POST requests. However, in the event queries must be submitted via GET requests, the URI encoding in use by the container hosting Solr (e.g. Tomcat) should be specified for the uri encoding parameter here. The servlet specification declares the default URI encoding is ISO-8859-1. However, some containers default to a different value (e.g. embedded Solr uses UTF-8). If queries sent via GET don't appear to work properly for extended ASCII or unicode characters, be sure this value is set properly for the container you are using.
        Parameters:
        configFile - Reference to the {doc}-search-config.xml file.
        sortColumns - Only useful for paging queries. Likely to be deprecated as sorting other than by score in Solr is not particular useful.
        uriEncoding - The setting for URI encoding of the container hosting Solr
